Question: For the purpose of applying the give way rule, entrance ways into public car parks should be treated as:
When parking downhill on a steep road, what does the road code suggest that you should do?

Answers.Answer: Leave your keys in the vehicle in case the brakes fail
Turn the front wheels of your vehicle away from the kerb and leave the vehicle in first gear
Turn the front wheels of your vehicle towards the kerb and leave the vehicle in reverse gear
Leave the wheels of your vehicle straight ahead and make sure that the handbrake is on

Question: When driving on a road with lanes you must be able to stop in half the length of clear road you can see in front of you.
At night, a towed vehicle must:

Answers.Answer: have a red light at the back

Question: What may you do at traffic signals if there is a green arrow pointing to the right and a red light showing at the same time?

Answers.Answer: You must stop until all lights turn green
You may turn left or right

Question: Which of your vehicle’s lights do you have on if you are driving in fog?
Which parts of the car must be in good condition to prevent too much noise and gases entering the car?

Answers.Answer: Good mud guards and mud flaps
A good silencer and exhaust system

Question: A police officer can impound your car on the spot if you are caught driving while disqualified.
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You must NOT park on the right-hand side of the road, except when:
You MUST dip the headlights on your vehicle when:

Answers.Answer: changing lanes in a one way street
changing lanes to exit the motorway

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: There has been a crash – slow down to 20km/h when passing this sign until you have passed the crash
There have been crashes here in the past – slow down
There has been a crash – but the road is clear now
This is an accident black spot

Question: Flush medians can be used when:
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When passing a bus displaying a School sign, that has stopped to let children on or off, what should your speed be?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What should you do if the vehicle behind you wishes to pass?

Answers.Answer: Move to the centre so that they cannot pass
Speed up so that they will not need to pass
Move as far to the left side of the road as is safe

Question: You are driving past a line of parked cars. You notice a ball bouncing out into the road ahead. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep driving at the same speed
Keep driving at the same speed and flash the vehicle’s headlights
Slow down and be prepared to stop for children
Slow down and move to the right-hand side of the road

Question: What must you do if glass falls on to the road from your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Sweep it up straight away if you can do so safely

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What must you do when you come up to a red light showing at traffic signals?

Answers.Answer: Stop and then go on carefully
Go on slowly if no other traffic is coming
Stop only if other vehicles are coming from the right
Stop and wait until it changes to a green light

Question: What should you do if your vehicle breaks down on a motorway?

Answers.Answer: Lift up the bonnet and boot of your vehicle
Push your vehicle to the nearest off-ramp

Question: What should you do when following another vehicle in wet conditions?

Answers.Answer: Drive closer to the vehicle so that you can follow in its tracks
Drive with your vehicle handbrake on

Question: You may park your vehicle over a fire hydrant if you:

Answers.Answer: leave your keys in your vehicle
have someone stay with the vehicle who can move it
leave a note on the vehicle saying ‘Back soon’
will not be away from the vehicle for more than 5 minutes

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What is shown by a white reflector (cat’s eye) placed on the road?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: Passengers in your vehicle are 15 years or over. Who is responsible for making sure they wear a safety belt (seat belt)?

Answers.Answer: You as the driver of the vehicle

Question: When you have a learner licence you must always drive with a supervisor. A supervisor is a person who has held a current and valid licence for a year.
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What does a white diamond painted on the road mean?
Your vehicle has a current warrant of fitness but a rear red brake light (stop light) is not working. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Only use the vehicle during daylight hours
Only use the vehicle in a 50km/h speed zone

Question: What should you do if you are driving and become sleepy?

Answers.Answer: Drive on the far left side of the road
Move off to the left of the road and have a rest
Speed up so that you can get home quickly
Keep on driving but use a lower gear

Question: You can be fined if your vehicle is on a road and not up to warrant of fitness standard.
You are driving on a country road at night when your vehicle headlights suddenly go out. What is the safest thing to do?

Answers.Answer: Carry on driving to the nearest garage with your vehicle hazard lights on
Slow down and drive on the far left side of the road
Carry on driving to the nearest garage with your vehicle’s interior lights on
Slow down, move off the road gradually, stop and turn your vehicle hazard lights on
